intro: Rubia corymbosa, commonly known as the Indian madder or red root, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Himalayas and parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. Its roots are rich in rubiadin, a red dye used historically in textile coloring. Rubia corymbosa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
